body:
### Structuring code You will learn how to organize your HTML as you progress and learn CSS as well. Otherwise, a great strategy is to indent nested elements with tabs. For example: ```html

This h1 element is inside the div element, meaning the `
` is the parent and the `

` is the child

this tag is a child of the `
` and a sibling of `

`.

An Unordered List: The `
    ` is the parent of the `
  • ` but is a child of the `
    `

  • Coffee
  • Tea
  • Milk
```
### Great overview of what you have learned!

### Anchor tags
Oooh yeah, link activated! Nice work using anchor tags!
Nice work using a variety of HTML tags, including both Blocked and Inline elements.

### Head Element and Body Element The `` element contains information about the webpage and the `` contains everything that is shown inside the main browser. ### Example Structuring ```html Title yo

Welcome to my notes yo

``` ### Title Element **``** element shows the contents at the top of the browser, above the URL. ### Result: `<title>Title yo` ![title.png](https://udacity-reviews-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/_attachments/616/1500576107/title.png) Check it out! https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_intro.asp

## File Type
### Great job submitting your work and including the `.html` extension!
                         
This project is more about getting comfortable with code reviews themselves than a strict code review. Future reviews will be more detailed as the projects themselves become more detailed and strict on the requirements.
